004
005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import java.util.function.Consumer;
008
009/**
010 * Topic change listener. This calls back to a callback function when a topic change matching the
011 * specified mask occurs. The callback function is called asynchronously on a separate thread, so
012 * it's important to use synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state from the
013 * callback function.
014 */
015public final class TopicListener implements AutoCloseable {
016  /**
017   * Create a listener for changes on a particular topic.
018   *
019   * @param topic Topic
020   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
021   * @param listener Listener function
022   */
023  public TopicListener(Topic topic, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
024    m_inst = topic.getInstance();
025    m_handle = m_inst.addTopicListener(topic, eventMask, listener);
026  }
027
028  /**
029   * Create a listener for topic changes on a subscriber. This does NOT keep the subscriber active.
030   *
031   * @param subscriber Subscriber
032   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
033   * @param listener Listener function
034   */
035  public TopicListener(Subscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
036    m_inst = subscriber.getTopic().getInstance();
037    m_handle = m_inst.addTopicListener(subscriber, eventMask, listener);
038  }
039
040  /**
041   * Create a listener for topic changes on a subscriber. This does NOT keep the subscriber active.
042   *
043   * @param subscriber Subscriber
044   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
045   * @param listener Listener function
046   */
047  public TopicListener(
048      MultiSubscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
049    m_inst = subscriber.getInstance();
050    m_handle = m_inst.addTopicListener(subscriber, eventMask, listener);
051  }
052
053  /**
054   * Create a listener for topic changes on an entry.
055   *
056   * @param entry Entry
057   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
058   * @param listener Listener function
059   */
060  public TopicListener(
061      NetworkTableEntry entry, int eventMask, Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
062    m_inst = entry.getInstance();
063    m_handle = m_inst.addTopicListener(entry, eventMask, listener);
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Create a listener for changes to topics with names that start with any of the given prefixes.
068   *
069   * @param inst Instance
070   * @param prefixes Topic name string prefixes
071   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
072   * @param listener Listener function
073   */
074  public TopicListener(
075      NetworkTableInstance inst,
076      String[] prefixes,
077      int eventMask,
078      Consumer<TopicNotification> listener) {
079    m_inst = inst;
080    m_handle = inst.addTopicListener(prefixes, eventMask, listener);
081  }
082
083  @Override
084  public synchronized void close() {
085    if (m_handle != 0) {
086      m_inst.removeTopicListener(m_handle);
087      m_handle = 0;
088    }
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
093   *
094   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
095   */
096  public boolean isValid() {
097    return m_handle != 0;
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Gets the native handle.
102   *
103   * @return Native handle
104   */
105  public int getHandle() {
106    return m_handle;
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Wait for the topic listener queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
111   * testing. This blocks until either the topic listener queue is empty (e.g. there are no more
112   * events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
113   *
114   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
115   *     block indefinitely
116   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
117   */
118  public boolean waitForQueue(double timeout) {
119    return m_inst.waitForTopicListenerQueue(timeout);
120  }
121
122  private final NetworkTableInstance m_inst;
123  private int m_handle;
124}
